actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-160, by Ms. Slaughter (NY).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2507 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substitute now printed in the bill as an original bill for the purpose of amendment. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment shall be in order except the amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution. Said amendments shall be considered in the order and manner specified, considered as having been read when offered, debatable for the period of time specified and shall not be subject to amendment except as specified in the report.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2507 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Energy and Commerce now printed in the bill as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 44.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2507) to amend the Public Health Service Act to revise and extend the programs of the National Institutes of Health, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2507 (public health programs).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2507) to amend the Public Health Service Act to revise and extend the programs of the National Institutes of Health, and for other purposes.
